name: Equatorial Guinea
description: Equatorial Guinea is a small, oil-rich nation on the Atlantic coast of Central Africa. It’s characterized by a dense rainforest interior and a long, sandy coastline. The country faces significant challenges related to poverty, inequality, and political instability, despite its substantial oil reserves.

quickFacts.label: Capital
quickFacts.description: The vibrant capital city, located on Annobón Island.
quickFacts.detail: Malabo is a bustling port city and the political and economic center of Equatorial Guinea.

quickFacts.label: Population
quickFacts.description: A relatively small population concentrated along the coast.
quickFacts.detail: The population is largely comprised of the Fang and Río communities.

quickFacts.label: Area
quickFacts.description: Mostly rainforest, with limited arable land.
quickFacts.detail: The country is almost entirely covered by dense tropical rainforest.

quickFacts.label: Official Language
quickFacts.description: Spanish is the official language, alongside French and Portuguese.
quickFacts.detail: Due to its colonial history, Spanish is the primary language of administration and education.

quickFacts.label: Currency
quickFacts.description: The currency is pegged to the CFA franc.
quickFacts.detail: The country's economy is heavily reliant on oil exports.

quickFacts.label: GDP
quickFacts.detail: Despite significant oil wealth, GDP per capita is extremely low.

climateData.title: Tropical Rainforest Climate
climateData.description: Equatorial Guinea experiences a tropical rainforest climate characterized by consistently high temperatures and humidity throughout the year. Rainfall is abundant and distributed relatively evenly.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Wet Season
seasonalCharacteristics.description: This period is marked by intense rainfall and increased humidity. Rivers swell, and flooding is common in low-lying areas.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Dry Season
seasonalCharacteristics.description: The dry season sees a reduction in rainfall, though it remains relatively wet. Temperatures remain consistently high.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Transition Seasons
seasonalCharacteristics.description: These periods represent transitional phases between the wet and dry seasons, with fluctuating rainfall and humidity levels.

naturalWonders.name: Bioko Island Rainforest
naturalWonders.description: Bioko Island is home to one of the most pristine and biodiverse rainforests in Africa. It’s a haven for endemic species and offers a glimpse into a largely untouched ecosystem.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The rainforest is characterized by towering trees, dense undergrowth, and a remarkable array of flora and fauna. The island’s isolation has allowed for the evolution of unique species found nowhere else on Earth.
viewingTips: Hire a local guide for navigation and wildlife spotting.
Wear long sleeves and trousers to protect against insects.

naturalWonders.name: Annobón Island Coral Reefs
naturalWonders.description: Off the coast of Annobón Island lies a vibrant coral reef system, teeming with marine life and offering excellent snorkeling and diving opportunities.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The reefs are relatively untouched by human activity, providing a sanctuary for a diverse range of coral species, fish, and invertebrates. The clear waters and abundant sunlight create ideal conditions for coral growth.

ecosystemData.title: Equatorial Guinea Ecosystems
ecosystemData.overview: Equatorial Guinea’s ecosystems are dominated by tropical rainforests, coastal wetlands, and coral reefs. The country’s biodiversity is exceptionally high, with many species found nowhere else in the world.

biodiversityCategories.name: Birds
biodiversityCategories.description: Equatorial Guinea is a birdwatcher’s paradise, boasting a remarkable diversity of avian species, including several endemic and migratory birds.

statistics.details: Many bird species are found only in Equatorial Guinea.
The country serves as a crucial stopover for migratory birds.

biodiversityCategories.name: Mammals
biodiversityCategories.description: The rainforests support a variety of mammals, including primates, rodents, and carnivores.

statistics.details: Several species of monkeys and apes inhabit the rainforest.
A diverse range of rodents contribute to the ecosystem.

activities.title: Outdoor Activities in Equatorial Guinea
activities.description: Equatorial Guinea offers a range of outdoor activities, from exploring rainforests to enjoying coastal scenery. However, access and infrastructure can be limited.

activityCategories.name: Hiking
activityCategories.description: Explore the rainforest trails and discover hidden waterfalls.

activities.name: Monte Cristo Hike
activities.description: A challenging trek to the summit of Monte Cristo, offering stunning views of the island.
activities.requirements: Sturdy hiking boots, waterproof clothing, insect repellent.

activityCategories.name: Water Sports
activityCategories.description: Enjoy snorkeling, diving, and kayaking along the coastline.

activities.name: Snorkeling & Diving at Annobón
activities.description: Explore the vibrant coral reefs and marine life of Annobón Island.

equipment.hiking: Hiking boots, trekking poles, map, compass.
